byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis reported from Athens. Liz Alderman contributed reporting from Paris, and James Kanter from Brussels.
byline.original: By JACK EWING and NIKI KITSANTONIS

abstract: Greek government faces criticism due to release of recording in which former Finance Min Yanis Varoufakis says in July 16 interview that government had contingency plan to create alternate banking system if it became necessary to leave euro; opposition members call on Prime Min Alexis Tsipras to explain recording and call for investigation.
lead_paragraph: The contingency plans for a possible exit from the euro began before the current leaders came to power, the former Greek finance minister said.

headline.main: Greece Made Preparations to Exit Euro
headline.print_headline: Greeks Made Secret Plan for Euro Exit
